data.title: Tabs name and title path
data.body:
When we have project with structure

```
project
    file.ext
    project
        file.ext
```

Both files have same tab name "file.ext - project", it's ok. But path in title also is the same for both and this is not ok.

data.title: atom showing old versions of files
data.body:
I have atom set up as my editor for git using `atom --wait --safe` (I added the safe today, this bug still appears).

When I make a commit, atom opens an old version of `COMMIT_EDITMSG`, from a week ago. If I go into the .git directory and do `cat COMMIT_EDITMSG`, I see the new copy. I can't figure out where atom is even getting these old file contents from.

data.title: Atom has trouble rendering files that are over 15k lines
data.body: Atom will freeze in the editor area When loading files that have 15k lines or more. Rendering around that area will stop and will look like regular text.

data.title: missing the "\b" backspace character from `show invisibles`
data.body:
The render does not show the backspace character correctly. However is can be found to be present by using the arrow keys on text like this:

`'Item',   ]` => `'Item', \b\b]`

data.title: gitignore of a file with the same name as the containing directory ignores the entire directory
data.body:
If I have a project structure like so:

MyProject
|   .gitignore
|   helloworld
|   |   .gitignore
|   |   main.go
|   |   helloworld (this is an executable called helloworld)
|   otherdir

In the MyProject/helloworld/.gitignore I add the line 'helloworld' to ignore the generated binary.

Atom then ignores ALL files in the MyProject/helloworld directory (even though git still recognizes them all). This causes some issues, for example, you can't use fuzzy search to open the files

However if I instead edit MyProject/.gitignore and add 'helloworld/helloworld' everything works as expected.

data.title: Available package updates count does not sync when updating packages from menu
data.body:
###### Using version 1.0.15 on Windows 7.
1. Status bar shows e.g. **1 update** (1 available package update)
2. Choose package updates from the menu
3. Update the package

Status still shows available updates. Restarting Atom refreshes this count.

data.title: Drop text from external application
data.body:
It would be great if atom would accept dropped text from another application. I haven't found a package that implements that functionality. 

My usecase is when I am writing a scientific paper in markdown. In gedit, I can easily drag citations from zotero into gedit and they get pasted in in the correct format (format selectable within zotero). This behavior is what I am looking to replicate in atom. 

Thanks,
Chris

data.title: Markdown breaks code folding in Literate CoffeeScript
data.body:
Atom supports [Literate Coffeescript](http://coffeescript.org/#literate), but the code folding breaks when presented with Markdown content, which is the entire point of Literate Coffeescript. A function which contains Markdown text will not fold correctly; the Markdown and anything following is considered immune to the fold.

![code-folding-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3488572/9997786/0ff2ee48-605c-11e5-8ff6-c33ffdf6db17.png)

data.title: Atom fails to build with runas version 2 as dependency
data.body:
When building Atom on Arch Linux, it fails with the following error.
https://gist.github.com/DuckThom/82e71087339f67cf2335

When changing `"runas": "^2",` to `"runas": "^3",` in `build/packages.json:36` the build continues and finishes successfully.

data.title: Trouble with acute accent in version 1.09
data.body:
Aftter a while of writting in spanish acute accents stop working, so for example if I want to write "ó,á,í" or other characters nothing appears written on the screen.

This issue is being fixed rebooting Atom.

data.title: Atom doesn't recognize .git files
data.body:
Git allows the .git directory to be a file instead which references the actual .git directory similar to a symlink.  This is a Git OS-agnostic link.   Atom does not recognize this as a proper .git directory and so it doesn't notice the Git project.  These .git files are used by default for submodules when initially cloning.

A related issue exists (#8168) which is specific to Git worktrees.  Worktrees use .git-files but they have a further specialization which makes them more complicated.

data.title: override "core-code" from package
data.body:
I am trying to write a semantic-highlighting package for atom, and right now I need to cache the previous content of a editor-line in order to find out what changed exactly (if there is another way to do it tell me :>).

 The Atom/first-mate-tokenizeLine()-function however dosnt get the linenumber when called from (atom/src/tokenize-buffer.js, TokenizedBuffer.buildTokenizedLineForRowWithText()). It would be easy to change. I wonder if I can override that behaviour in my package.

data.title: Atom not updating some files during rebase
data.body:
This was a weird one. I was rebasing a series of commits.
Git was telling me there were merge conflicts on the file but I was only seeing them in some files flagged by the rebase.
I continued the rebase several times and saw that merge conflicts were now present in my html on the page when I finished the rebase. I restarted atom and found I had several merges folded on top of each other.

In future I'll have to restart atom if I see that rebased files aren't showing their changes from merges, but it's a really unpleasant bug as I have to restart the rebase now.

After I finished the rebase I went looking for the conflicts by searching for (>>>).
I could find the merge arrows in the search but clicking on them brought me to the file where it wasn't showing the updates. It even said there were merge conflicts on lines that were longer than the length of  the file.

The project is pretty large, so this may be memory based or specific to my machine. If it occurs again I can submit screenshots.

data.title: Remove deprecated code
data.body:
In #8680 we have removed some deprecated events but we were still performing some operations which should be now unnecessary.

Other than tightening the codebase, this should bring some speedups when adding selections as well, 'cause we don't need to call `editor.selectionIntersectsVisibleRowRange` anymore.

/cc: @nathansobo for :eyes:

data.title: Running Slow
data.body:
Hey,
I am running version 1.0.15 on Windows 10. Currently I have the problem that I have massive performance problems when editing text. I have not installed any new packages and also tried to disable all community packages, however the problem still persists. 
The unresponsiveness occurs very short after starting atom and there is plenty of free memory on my machine if that is any help.
Also this happens especially (but not exclusively) after pasting text. Might be a performance issue with the text rendering (I tried to disable spellcheck, however without any effect)?

data.title: "npm ERR!" when trying to build 1.0.15 (wrong cson-safe version?)
data.body:
An output excerpt when trying to build Atom from the Arch AUR:

```
Node: v4.1.0
npm: v3.3.3
Installing build modules...
npm ERR! Linux 4.1.6-1-ARCH
npm ERR! argv "/usr/bin/node" "/usr/bin/npm" "--userconfig=/tmp/pacaurtmp-novirium/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.15/build/.npmrc" "install" "--loglevel" "error"
npm ERR! node v4.1.0
npm ERR! npm  v3.3.3
npm ERR! code EREADFILE

npm ERR! Error extracting /home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.4/package.tgz archive: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.4/package.tgz'
```

The relevant parts of npm-debug.log:

```
28309 verbose addNamed "1.0.5" is a plain semver version for cson-safe
28310 silly cache afterAdd cson-safe@1.0.5
28311 verbose afterAdd /home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.5/package/package.json not in flight; writing
28312 verbose afterAdd /home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.5/package/package.json written
28313 silly rollbackFailedOptional Starting
28314 silly rollbackFailedOptional Finishing
28315 silly runTopLevelLifecycles Starting
28316 silly runTopLevelLifecycles Finishing
28317 silly install printInstalled
28318 verbose stack Error: Error extracting /home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.4/package.tgz archive: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.4/package.tgz'
28318 verbose stack     at ReadStream.<anonymous> (/usr/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:276:10)
28318 verbose stack     at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
28318 verbose stack     at ReadStream.emit (events.js:169:7)
28318 verbose stack     at /usr/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/graceful-fs/graceful-fs.js:179:14
28318 verbose stack     at /usr/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/graceful-fs/graceful-fs.js:230:16
28318 verbose stack     at FSReqWrap.oncomplete (fs.js:82:15)
28319 verbose cwd /tmp/pacaurtmp-novirium/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.15/build
28320 error Linux 4.1.6-1-ARCH
28321 error argv "/usr/bin/node" "/usr/bin/npm" "--userconfig=/tmp/pacaurtmp-novirium/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.15/build/.npmrc" "install" "--loglevel" "error"
28322 error node v4.1.0
28323 error npm  v3.3.3
28324 error code EREADFILE
28325 error Error extracting /home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.4/package.tgz archive: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/novirium/.atom/.npm/cson-safe/1.0.4/package.tgz'
28326 error If you need help, you may report this error at:
28326 error     <https://github.com/npm/npm/issues>
28327 verbose exit [ 1, true ]
```

I honestly don't know a lot about the npm build process, but this looks like it's downloading cson-safe version 1.0.5, then trying to extract a package named 1.0.4 instead.

data.title: Atom v1.0.15 keeps freezing/crashing on Windows 10
data.body:
Hi,

I am new to Atom and I just started to use it with Julia (packages language-julia, julia-client, ink). I have the version 1.0.15 installed on Windows 10. It runs fine a while but it keeps crashing when I run my Julia code always at the same place. I don't know if it is an issue with the packages or with Atom. How can I find out what causes the crash / freeze?

Thanks
Serge

data.title: questions: key shortcut and start
data.body:
1.why key shortcut use webstorm double cilck change…
2.default disable all plugins keyshortcut ，show key exec command at readme，users  control on/off（like checkbox）

3.atom start time very slow （compare for sublime）……next version can reduce start time？

data.title: Packages that add a popup at the bottom of the editor can hide my cursor
data.body:
The simplest way to observe this is to write things near the bottom of a file and trigger `Project Find: Show`. The find form appears at the bottom, hiding the part of the file you're working on. This is not particularly bothersome for `find`, but it's really annoying when the `linter` package, linting on every keystroke, shows errors that hide the part of the file you're working on (making it difficult to fix the linting errors without scrolling down.

Have a look at [this issue](https://github.com/atom-community/linter/issues/895#issuecomment-141793355) for a better description of why this is annoying.

data.title: Methods working on buffer/screen lines should include word Buffer/Screen in name
data.body:
In https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/8828#issuecomment-141222197, @nathansobo mentioned:

> Ideally every method would be explicit with regards to `Screen` or `Buffer` if there were a chance for ambiguity. So if anything I would deprecate anything ambiguous and mention `Screen` explicitly if we ever wanted to rev our API again. Not sure it's really worth it right now though.

I agree it would be good to do this, but also that it's not a priority right now. So here's an issue tagged with the `api` label to help us not forget about this. :memo:

data.title: :bug: Teach Atom to read .git files
data.body: This fixes part of #8168.  The git-worktree model still is not supported, but this is because it is so new that libgit2 doesn't know about it yet, either.  But the .git-file feature which is heavily used by submodules works with this fix.

data.title: Multiple theme/syntax switching causes errors
data.body:
**Edit:** If you want to skip all my own troubleshooting start reading at this comment: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8860#issuecomment-141775143

---

The Light UI theme shows dark parts when I switch from Atom dark theme to Atom light:
![atomlightdesign](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/9838056/b0758f60-5a53-11e5-9da6-a65c6bdcdb7d.PNG)

I don't know whether it's caused by the core or by another package, but I'm trying to get this out.
Actually when I run Atom with the -safe-mode option it works.
